raw_text: In general, co reference errors in state-of-theart systems are frequently due to poor models of semantic compatibility (Haghighi and Klein, 2009) .In this work, we take a primarily unsupervised approach to co reference resolution, broadly similar toHaghighi and Klein (2007), which addresses this issue
clean_text: In general, coreference errors in state-of-the art systems are frequently due to poor models of semantic compatibility (Haghighi and Klein, 2009).

raw_text: Additionally, we disallow nominals from having direct pronoun antecedents. In addition to the above, if a mention is in a deterministic co reference configuration, as defined in Haghighi and Klein (2009), we force it to take the required antecedent
clean_text: In addition to the above, if a mention is in a deterministic coreference configuration, as defined in Haghighi and Klein (2009), we force it to take the required antecedent.

raw_text: For? r, we use a deterministic entity assignment Zr, similar to the Haghighiand Klein (2009)? s SYN-CONSTR setting: each referring mention is co referent with any past mention with the same head or in a deterministic syntactic configuration (appositives or predicative nominatives constructions) .6 The {ri} factors are heuristically set to place most of their mass on the closest antecedent by tree distance
clean_text: For r, we use a deterministic entity assignment Zr, similar to the Haghighi and Klein (2009)'s SYN-CONSTR setting: each referring mention is coreferent with any past mention with the same head or in a deterministic syntactic configuration (appositives or predicative nominatives constructions).

raw_text: All systems except Haghighi and Klein (2009) and current workare fully supervised
clean_text: All systems except Haghighi and Klein (2009) and current work are fully supervised.

raw_text: We also com pared to the strong deterministic system of Haghighi and Klein (2009) .10 Across all data sets, our model, despite being largely unsupervised, consistently outperforms these systems, which are the best previously reported results on end-to-end co reference resolution (i.e. including mention detection)
clean_text: We also compared to the strong deterministic system of Haghighi and Klein (2009).

raw_text: 10Haghighi and Klein (2009) reports on true mentions; here, we report performance on automatically detected mentions
clean_text: Haghighi and Klein (2009) reports on true mentions; here, we report performance on automatically detected mentions.

raw_text: Our model does not represent the negative covariance between these modifiers. We compared our output to the deterministic system of Haghighi and Klein (2009)
clean_text: We compared our output to the deterministic system of Haghighi and Klein (2009).

The other systems we compare to and outperform are the perceptron-based Reconcile system of Stoyanov et al (2009), the strong deterministic system of Haghighi and Klein (2009), and the cluster-ranking model of Rahman and Ng (2009) .We develop our features and tune their hyper parameter values on the ACE04 development set and then use these on the ACE04 test set.12 OntheACE05 and ACE05-ALL datasets, we directly transfer our Web features and their hyper-parameter values from the ACE04dev-set, without any retuning

raw_text: The different steps are described below: PREPROCESSDATA: We start by preprocessing all the news in the news collections with a standard NLP pipeline :tokenization and sentence boundary detection (Gillick, 2009), part-of-speech tagging, dependency parsing (Nivre, 2006), co reference resolution (Haghighi and Klein, 2009) and entity linking based on Wikipedia and Free base
clean_text: We start by preprocessing all the news in the news collections with a standard NLP pipeline: tokenization and sentence boundary detection (Gillick, 2009), part-of-speech tagging, dependency parsing (Nivre, 2006), coreference resolution (Haghighi and Klein, 2009) and entity linking based on Wikipedia and Freebase.
